snippet: The New York City Police Department effort, known as Operation Crew Cut, uses social media to prevent emerging conflicts and build cases against agitators.
abstract: New York City Police Department is shifting emphasis from controversial stop-and-frisk tactic to focus more on rooting out youth gangs; effort known as Operation Crew Cut uses social media to prevent emerging conflicts and build cases against agitators; while new strategy has raised some objections, including privacy concerns, it has also garnered support from stop-and-frisk tactic’s greatest critics.

byline.original: By JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and J. DAVID GOODMAN

lead_paragraph: The New York City Police Department effort, known as Operation Crew Cut, uses social media to prevent emerging conflicts and build cases against agitators.

headline.main: Frisking Tactic Yields to a Focus on Youth Gangs
headline.print_headline: Frisking Tactic Yields to a Focus on Youth Gangs
